verbs.description: [ARG0: A Los Angeles Antifa group , the Red Guards ,] [V: celebrated] [ARG1: May Day] [ARGM-MNR: by holding a small march , hanging a Trump effigy , and calling for " revolutionary violence " against the " capitalist state] , " according to published reports . " We must carry out military actions against the enemies of the people ! ” a member of the L.A. cell of the Red Guards wrote on the group 's blog . PJ Media explains the groups political stance : The Red Guards is a Maoist group that hopes to duplicate in the United States the anarchy and terror Chairman Mao 's Red Guards inflicted on China during the Cultural Revolution of the 1960s and 1970s . The group also identifies as " antifascist " and has cells throughout the United States . https://twitter.com/FarLeftWatch/status/992131773416005633 Throughout the world , " hundreds of thousands of leftists " mobilized for the annual “ International Workers ' Day ” on May 1 to advocate for various " social justice causes " and celebrate communism . The Red Guard 's blog states that it stands " in solidarity with the Red …
